stimulusHtml: One student titrated the NaOH(aq) with 1.0 M HCl(aq) instead of 0.10 M HCl(aq). How would the studentâ€™s titration curve differ from the original curve?

features.html: To determine the concentration of a NaOH(aq) solution, a student titrated a 50. mL sample with 0.10 M HCl(aq) . The reaction is represented by the equation above. The titration is monitored using a pH meter, and the experimental results are plotted in the graph below.

choicesHtml: The initial pH would be 11 instead of 13.
The pH at the equivalence point would be 5 instead of 7.
The pH far beyond the equivalence point would be higher than in the original curve.
The pH far beyond the equivalence point would be lower than in the original curve.
